title: Chris Hemsworth takes his dog Sunny out for a walk in Byron Bay
text:
Chris Hemsworth breathed a sigh of relief last month when his beloved family dog Sunny was found by a neighbour after going missing for several days.

And the Avengers star went for a stroll with Sunny, who is a cross between a golden retriever and a poodle, near his home in Byron Bay, NSW on Friday.

Chris, 36, went barefoot in a loose grey T-shirt, blue shorts and a baseball cap while walking his pooch around the beachside town.

Reunited at last! Chris Hemsworth took his beloved pooch Sunny out for a walk in Byron Bay on Friday, after the dog went missing for several days last month

Chris, who has lived in Byron Bay since 2014, kept a low profile in dark sunglasses.

He made sure to keep Sunny on his leash at all times after the dog went walkabout last month, sparking a frantic neighbourhood search.

In early September, the Hemsworths' friends in Byron Bay rallied to find the dog, who ran off after being zapped by an electric fence.

Flying under the radar? Chris, who has lived in Byron Bay since 2014, kept a low profile in dark sunglasses and a baseball cap

After three days, and thanks to the efforts of the Byron Bay community, Sunny was reunited with the Hemsworths.

A family friend, Leah Grist, alerted locals to the news via a neighbourhood Facebook group, writing: 'Sunny has been FOUND this morning.

'Thank you to everyone for all their help, shares and wishes to bring Sunny home.'

Walkies! Chris made sure to keep Sunny on his leash at all times after the dog went walkabout last month, sparking a frantic neighbourhood search

Before the dog was safely found, Chris' longtime friend and personal trainer Luke Zocchi had shared a missing poster via Instagram.

The poster outlined Sunny's appearance and described her as a 'much-loved family pet'.

Chris lives in Byron Bay with his wife Elsa Pataky, 43, and their children: seven-year-old daughter India Rose and five-year-old twin sons Sasha and Tristan.
description: Chris Hemsworth  breathed a  sigh of relief last month when his beloved family dog Sunny was found by a neighbour after going missing for several days.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
